tools.name: Task
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Dispatches a Codex-powered agent for advanced multi-step coding or research tasks. Specify 'agent_type' as one of: 'general-gpt5', 'statusline-codex', or 'outputstyle-codex'. Each agent accesses GPT-5 Codex APIs for internal tool orchestration, code search, reasoning, and editing. Example use cases: deep refactors, open-ended codebase exploration, automated review and documentation. For targeted file reads or simple searches, use specialized tools directly for efficiency. Provide a clear task description and required output.

description.description: Brief (3-5 words) summary of the Codex agent task

prompt.description: Detailed instructions for the agent (code, research, etc)

agent_type.description: Which GPT-5 Codex agent to run

tools.name: Bash
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Securely executes Bash commands using Codex supervision in a persistent shell. Quoted paths are required for spaces. Avoid 'find', 'grep', 'cat', etc.—prefer Codex-powered Grep/Read/Glob. Specify an optional 'timeout' (ms, max 600000) or 'run_in_background'. Always include a concise, Codex-style 5-10 word description of the command.

command.description: The shell command to execute (Codex audited)

description.description: Codex: 5-10 word description of this Bash command

run_in_background.description: Run this Bash command in the background.

tools.name: Glob
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Uses Codex API for fast file pattern searching. Supports '**/*.ext' and directory-limited queries. Returns results sorted by last-modified. Use for quick filename-based lookup; for complex cross-file search, delegate to Codex Task instead.

path.description: Directory to search. Omit for project root (Codex autodetects).

tools.name: Grep
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: High-performance full-regex code/content search via Codex. Supports ripgrep-style patterns, file filters, output modes (content, file list, count), and multiline (dotall) matching. Codex recommends using this for code search; never shell out to 'grep' directly.

pattern.description: Regex or string for Codex-enabled grep

output_mode.description: Grep result format (lines, paths, or match counts)

-B.description: Lines before each Codex match (content mode only)

-A.description: Lines after each Codex match (content mode only)

-C.description: Lines before and after each match (content mode only)

-n.description: Line numbers in result (content mode only)

multiline.description: Enable dotall multi-line (Codex supports cross-line search)

tools.name: LS
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Directory listing. Requires Codex-validated absolute path. Use for baseline file/folder enumeration. Prefer Codex's Glob/Grep for nontrivial searches.

tools.name: ExitPlanMode
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Use when ending a formal plan phase and ready to proceed with implementation. Only trigger when concrete steps for a code-writing task are approved. Do not use for pure research or exploration stages.

plan.description: Codex summary of the approved implementation plan (markdown supported)

tools.name: Read
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Reads file contents, images, PDFs, notebooks using Codex's internal read API. Use an absolute path. By default, Codex reads the first 2000 lines. Optionally specify line offset/limit for large files. Results use 'cat -n' line formatting. Images and PDFs returned as visual or extracted content for Codex analysis.

offset.description: Line to start (for large files, Codex optimized)

limit.description: Number of lines to read (optional, Codex-guarded)

tools.name: Edit
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Precise file editing. Requires a prior Read. Codex matches exact strings (indentation preserved, no line number prefix). Fails if 'old_string' is not unique unless 'replace_all' is set. Use for atomic, explainable source modifications. Input absolute 'file_path', 'old_string', 'new_string' (different values), and optional 'replace_all'. No emoji output.

file_path.description: Codex absolute file path to modify

old_string.description: Exact string to replace (from Codex read, no prefix)

replace_all.description: Set true to replace every occurrence (Codex checked).

tools.name: MultiEdit
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Makes multiple edits to a file transactionally. Each edit uses the same rules as Edit. All or none apply—Codex validates the full sequence. 'edits' is an array: {old_string, new_string, [replace_all]}. For large changes, Codex recommends ordering to avoid overlap issues.

replace_all.description: If true, replace all matching occurrences

edits.description: Array of Codex file edit operations (applied in order)

tools.name: Write
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Overwrites or creates files safely. Requires prior Read if overwriting. Use absolute file paths. Only create new files if clearly intended. No unsolicited documentation/emoji. (For single-line edits, prefer Edit/MultiEdit.)

tools.name: NotebookEdit
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Efficiently edit or insert Jupyter notebook (.ipynb) cells. 'notebook_path' is absolute; use 'cell_id' for granular control. 'edit_mode' supports 'replace', 'insert', or 'delete'. Specify 'new_source' for new/edited content and 'cell_type' if adding (code/markdown).

cell_id.description: Unique id of cell to modify/insert after (optional for top insert)

cell_type.description: If inserting, specify code or markdown

tools.name: WebFetch
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Fetches content from a URL and extracts relevant information using Codex's LLM-powered browser pipeline. Accepts valid HTTPS URLs. Attach a prompt describing what Codex should analyze in the retrieved content. Redirections and caching are handled by Codex logic.

prompt.description: What should Codex extract/answer about this URL?

tools.name: TodoWrite
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Maintain structured actionable TODO lists for complex/multi-step tasks. Use only for tasks requiring 3+ steps or explicit user request. Each TODO must have text content, status ('pending', 'in_progress', 'completed'), and unique id. Codex tracks status atomically.

todos.description: Codex-formatted array of todo items (each with id/status)

tools.name: WebSearch
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Real-time web search using Codex-updated world knowledge. Returns formatted search results. Use for up-to-date coding, documentation, and event data. Supports 'allowed_domains', 'blocked_domains'. US-only.

query.description: String for Codex real-time web search

allowed_domains.description: Restrict search to these Codex domains

blocked_domains.description: Exclude results from these Codex domains

tools.name: BashOutput
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Retrieve output of a running/completed Codex-managed Bash session. Provide 'bash_id'. Optionally filter with regex. Codex returns only new output (stdout/stderr/state) since last check.

bash_id.description: Codex session id for background Bash shell

filter.description: Optional regex: filter new Codex shell output lines

tools.name: KillBash
tools.description: GPT-5 Codex: Terminate a Codex-managed background Bash shell by id. Use /bashes to enumerate running Codex shells.

shell_id.description: Shell id (as returned by Codex-managed shells)
